Detailed Description

Provides access to information about the telephony services on the device.

Applications can use the methods in this class to determine telephony services and states, as well as to access some types of subscriber information. Applications can also register a listener to receive notification of telephony state changes.

You do not instantiate this class directly; instead, you retrieve a reference to an instance through Context.getSystemService(Context.TELEPHONY_SERVICE).

Note that acess to some telephony information is permission-protected. Your application cannot access the protected information unless it has the appropriate permissions declared in its manifest file. Where permissions apply, they are noted in the the methods through which you access the protected information.

 // Create TelephonyManager instance with application context
 TelephonyManager* telephonyManager = new TelephonyManager(context_instance);
 // Get Network operator name in string
 telephonyManager->getNetworkOperatorName().string();

Definition at line 54 of file TelephonyManager.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::telephony::TelephonyManager::CALL_STATE

CALL_STATE.

Enumerator:
CALL_STATE_IDLE 

Device call state: No activity.

CALL_STATE_RINGING 

Device call state: Ringing.

A new call arrived and is ringing or waiting. In the latter case, another call is already active.

CALL_STATE_OFFHOOK 

Device call state: Off-hook.

At least one call exists that is dialing, active, or on hold, and no calls are ringing or waiting.

Definition at line 116 of file TelephonyManager.h.

enum gaia::telephony::TelephonyManager::DATA_ACTIVITY

DATA_ACTIVITY.

Enumerator:
DATA_ACTIVITY_NONE 

Data connection activity: No traffic.

DATA_ACTIVITY_IN 

Data connection activity: Currently receiving IP PPP traffic.

DATA_ACTIVITY_OUT 

Data connection activity: Currently sending IP PPP traffic.

DATA_ACTIVITY_INOUT 

Data connection activity: Currently both sending and receiving IP PPP traffic.

DATA_ACTIVITY_DORMANT 

Data connection is active, but physical link is down.

Definition at line 130 of file TelephonyManager.h.

enum gaia::telephony::TelephonyManager::DATA_STATE

DATA_STATE.

Enumerator:
DATA_STATE_DISCONNECTED 

Data connection state: Disconnected.

IP traffic not available.

DATA_STATE_CONNECTING 

Data connection state: Currently setting up a data connection.

DATA_STATE_CONNECTED 

Data connection state: Connected.

IP traffic should be available.

DATA_STATE_SUSPENDED 

Data connection state: Suspended.

The connection is up, but IP traffic is temporarily unavailable. For example, in a 2G network, data activity may be suspended when a voice call arrives.

enum gaia::telephony::TelephonyManager::NETWORK_TYPE

NETWORK_TYPE.

Enumerator:
NETWORK_TYPE_UNKNOWN 

Network type is unknown.

NETWORK_TYPE_GPRS 

Current network is GPRS.

NETWORK_TYPE_EDGE 

Current network is EDGE.

NETWORK_TYPE_UMTS 

Current network is UMTS.

NETWORK_TYPE_CDMA 

Current network is CDMA: Either IS95A or IS95B.

NETWORK_TYPE_EVDO_0 

Current network is EVDO revision 0.

NETWORK_TYPE_EVDO_A 

Current network is EVDO revision A.

NETWORK_TYPE_1xRTT 

Current network is 1xRTT.

NETWORK_TYPE_HSDPA 

Current network is HSDPA.

NETWORK_TYPE_HSUPA 

Current network is HSUPA.

NETWORK_TYPE_HSPA 

Current network is HSPA.

NETWORK_TYPE_IDEN 

Current network is iDen.

NETWORK_TYPE_EVDO_B

NETWORK_TYPE_LTE 
NETWORK_TYPE_EHRPD 
NETWORK_TYPE_HSPAP 

Current network is HSPAP.

enum gaia::telephony::TelephonyManager::PhoneType

The Radio type of phone.

One of the following:

  • PHONE_TYPE_NONE = No phone
  • PHONE_TYPE_GSM = GSM phone
  • PHONE_TYPE_CDMA = CDMA phone
  • PHONE_TYPE_SIP = SIP phone

Definition at line 183 of file TelephonyManager.h.

enum gaia::telephony::TelephonyManager::SIM_STATE

SIM_STATE.

Enumerator:
SIM_STATE_UNKNOWN 

SIM card state: Unknown.

Signifies that the SIM is in transition between states. For example, when the user inputs the SIM pin under PIN_REQUIRED state, a query for sim status returns this state before turning to SIM_STATE_READY.

SIM_STATE_ABSENT 

SIM card state: no SIM card is available in the device.

SIM_STATE_PIN_REQUIRED 

SIM card state: Locked: requires the user's SIM PIN to unlock.

SIM_STATE_PUK_REQUIRED 

SIM card state: Locked: requires the user's SIM PUK to unlock.

SIM_STATE_NETWORK_LOCKED 

SIM card state: Locked: requries a network PIN to unlock.

SIM_STATE_READY 

SIM card state: Ready.

gaia::base::String gaia::telephony::TelephonyManager::getNetworkCountryIso ( ) const

Returns the ISO country code equivalent of the current registered operator's MCC (Mobile Country Code).

Availability: Only when user is registered to a network. Result may be unreliable on CDMA networks (use getPhoneType() to determine if on a CDMA network).

gaia::base::String gaia::telephony::TelephonyManager::getNetworkOperator ( ) const

Returns the numeric name (MCC+MNC) of current registered operator.

Availability: Only when user is registered to a network. Result may be unreliable on CDMA networks (use getPhoneType() to determine if on a CDMA network).

void gaia::telephony::TelephonyManager::listen ( const PhoneStateListener &  listener,
uint32_t  events 
)

Registers a listener object to receive notification of changes in specified telephony states.

To register a listener, pass a PhoneStateListener and specify at least one telephony state of interest in the events argument.

At registration, and when a specified telephony state changes, the telephony manager invokes the appropriate callback method on the listener object and passes the current (udpated) values.

To unregister a listener, pass the listener object and set the events argument to {PhoneStateListener LISTEN_NONE LISTEN_NONE} (0).

Parameters:
listenerThe PhoneStateListener object to register (or unregister)
eventsThe telephony state(s) of interest to the listener, as a bitwise-OR combination of PhoneStateListener LISTEN_ flags.
TelephonyManager& gaia::telephony::TelephonyManager::operator= ( const TelephonyManager &  other)
